text: André Robert Breton (; 18 February 1896 – 28 September 1966) was a French writer, poet and anti-fascist. He is known best as the co-founder and principal theorist of Surrealism.Lawrence Gowing, ed., Biographical Encyclopedia of Artists, v.1 (Facts on File, 2005): 84. His works include the first Surrealist Manifesto (Manifeste du surréalisme) of 1924, in which he defined surrealism as "pure psychic automatism". He led a surrealist group with members like Salvador Dali and Max Ernest. ==References== Category:1896 births Category:1966 deaths Category:French writers Category:French atheists Category:20th-century writers
title: André Breton
